page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY,SAUNDERSFOOT.
page.content: Speaking to four elderly people of the village,born between 1900 and 1905 gave us an insight into what life was like in Edwardian days.Although the village was much smaller then everyone was gainfully employed,mainly due to the fact that most people were craftsmen with apprentices.Some were carpenters,ironmongers,blacksmiths and leather workers. Many of the young men worked in the mines at Bonvilles Court.Frank Williams led pony trucks of coal from the coalface to the liftshaft.The Mine Co.was the main employer of the day. Mary Griffiths and Albert Howells were both born in Railway St.(now called The Strand) so called because trains ran along there taking miners to work. The gentry travelled by horse drawn carriage and Mr Howells recalled jumping on the back,hitching a lift.
